poem:
Title: Privilege's Child

The sapling, sprung from well-fed roots,
Boasts not its birthright, yet bears fruit.
In the shade of legacy's towering tree,
No vain defence of pedigree.
Deeply sown in fertile caste,
Yet, a truth too rare to taste:
In the garden of acclaim,
No seed self-sows fame's familiar name. Careful,
Daughter of the silver screen,
To honour where your roots have been.
